revised_title: Catalytic Efficiency of Metals in Ammonia-Deuterium Exchange Reaction
tldr: The authors investigated the efficiency of various metals in the ammonia-deuterium exchange reaction on evaporated metal films. They found that the relative amounts of deutero-ammonias formed were independent of the catalyst used. The study also provided insights into the activation energies and frequency factors for the reaction on different metals. The results contribute to understanding the influence of electronic and geometrical properties of catalysts on the efficiency of chemical reactions.
